com.cubeia.firebase.api.service.dosprotect
Interface DosProtector

All Superinterfaces:
Contract
public interface DosProtector
extends Contract

This service is used to perform rudimentary protection from DOS attacks. Protection is performed with an "X actions over Y time" algorithm which can only be set manually at the moment.

Services using this service are identified with a string key, each registration checks the frequency rules and returns true if the call is allowed and false otherwise.

NB:

All string identifiers starting with "_" are reserved by Firebase.

Author:
Larsan

Method Summary
 boolean allow(String key, Object callerId)
          Check access for an identifier and a caller.
 void config(String key, Rule... rules)
          This method is used to manually configure the service for a particular identifier.
 

Method Detail

config

void config(String key,
            Rule... rules)
This method is used to manually configure the service for a particular identifier. It should be observed that this will clear all available data, ie reset the rules for the identifier.

NB: The rules will not be copied, so please don't keep the around or change them after invoking this method.

To remove rules, set the rule set to null.

NB:

All string identifiers starting with "_" are reserved by Firebase.

Parameters:
key - Rule access identifier, must not be null
rules - Rules to use, may be null to remove rules

allow

boolean allow(String key,
              Object callerId)
Check access for an identifier and a caller. If the access is allowed by the current rule set.

Parameters:
key - Rule access identifier, must not be null
callerId - Id of the caller which is to be checked, must not be null
Returns:
True if access is allowed, false otherwise
